glossary.definition: A structured set of questions used to collect information from participants
A standardized test measuring psychological traits, abilities, or characteristics
Mexican labor standard for identifying, analyzing, and preventing psychosocial risk factors
An individual item in a survey that collects a specific piece of information
Conditional logic that shows different questions based on previous answers

business_rules: Surveys must have at least one question defined
Survey questions must have valid question types (multiple choice, scale, text, etc.)
Psychometric assessments must use validated question sets
NOM-035 surveys must comply with regulatory requirements
Survey configuration must define distribution and completion rules
Question branching logic must be valid and non-circular
Surveys can be anonymous or identified based on configuration
Survey templates can be reused and customized
Survey versioning must be maintained for updates
Survey scheduling must respect participant availability
calculations_or_formulas: Average response time = sum of completion_times / number of completions
Survey score = calculated based on question types and scoring rules
invariants: Survey must have at least one question
Question must have valid question type
Question branching must not create cycles
Survey distribution must target valid participants
edge_cases: Survey is updated while evaluations are in progress - system versions survey, maintains participants in original version
Question branching logic creates cycle - system detects cycle, prevents creation, flags error
Participant starts survey but doesn't complete - system saves partial responses, allows completion later
Survey distribution fails - system retries, logs error, alerts administrator
NOM-035 compliance requirements change - system updates survey, maintains compliance history
Psychometric assessment scoring fails - system flags error, uses fallback calculation or manual review
Survey question is removed mid-evaluation - system handles existing responses, maintains data integrity
Survey anonymity is violated - system detects and prevents, logs violation attempt
compliance_requirements: NOM-035 surveys must comply with Mexican labor regulations
Survey data must be protected and access-controlled
Participant anonymity must be maintained for anonymous surveys
Survey results must be retained for compliance and audit purposes
Psychometric assessments must use validated instruments
user_journeys: HR creates survey - defines questions and configuration, survey is available for distribution
HR configures NOM-035 survey - selects compliance template, customizes questions, survey is ready
System distributes survey - sends invitations to participants, tracks distribution status
Participant completes survey - answers questions, submits responses, completion is recorded
System calculates survey results - aggregates responses, calculates scores, generates reports
acceptance_criteria_suggestions: Given survey creation, when questions are defined, then survey is created and available for distribution
Given survey distribution, when participants are selected, then invitations are sent and distribution is tracked
Given survey completion, when participant submits responses, then completion is recorded and results are calculated
Given NOM-035 survey, when compliance requirements are met, then survey is validated and ready for distribution
Given question branching, when logic is defined, then branching is validated and applied during evaluation
open_questions: What are the specific survey question types? (multiple choice? scale? text? matrix?)
How are psychometric assessments validated? (certification? internal validation?)
What is the NOM-035 compliance process? (mandatory? frequency? reporting?)
How are survey results interpreted? (automatic scoring? manual review? hybrid?)
What is the survey distribution method? (email? in-app? both?)
How are survey templates managed? (versioning? customization? reuse?)
assumptions: Surveys consist of questions with various types
Psychometric assessments use validated question sets
NOM-035 surveys must comply with regulatory requirements
Survey distribution targets specific participant groups
Survey results are aggregated and analyzed for insights
